{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-176-15-A
|Item_parent=Infectious diarrhoea in adults and children
|Item_parent_short=Infectious diarrhoea in adults and children
|Rank=A
|Title=Knowing the definition of a collective foodborne outbreak
|Description=See item 179
|Rubric=Definition
|Contributors=Johann Cailhol
|Order=15}}
See [[Health risks related to food and water. Food poisoning|item 179]]

question.question: What is a collective foodborne outbreak?
question.option_a: An outbreak involving only one food item
question.option_b: An outbreak involving multiple food items and at least two cases of gastrointestinal illness
question.option_c: An outbreak involving a single case of gastrointestinal illness
question.option_d: An outbreak involving a food item and a non-food related illness
